Specifically, stage IIIA refers to a tumor of any size that has invaded the adventitia or adjacent structures, with metastasis in one to two regional lymph nodes. Stage IIIB refers to a tumor of any size that has invaded the adventitia or adjacent structures, with metastasis in three or more regional lymph nodes. Stage IIIC refers to a tumor of any size that has invaded the adventitia or adjacent structures, with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes.
